author: George R.R. Martin
title: A Game of Thrones
description: The first book in the epic fantasy series A Song of Ice and Fire. Set in the fictional continents of Westeros and Essos, it follows the political machinations of noble families vying for control of the Iron Throne of the Seven Kingdoms.

author: Agatha Christie
title: Murder on the Orient Express
description: Hercule Poirot investigates a murder aboard the famous Orient Express train when it becomes snowbound in the Yugoslav mountains. A classic locked-room mystery with a surprising solution.

author: Isaac Asimov
title: Foundation
description: The first novel in Asimov's Foundation series, set in a galactic empire on the brink of collapse. Hari Seldon develops psychohistory to predict the future and establish foundations to preserve knowledge through the coming dark age.

title: The Odyssey
description: An ancient Greek epic poem traditionally attributed to Homer, telling the story of Odysseus's ten-year journey home after the Trojan War. Filled with mythological creatures, gods, and tests of heroism.

author: Liu Cixin
title: The Three-Body Problem
description: The first book in the Remembrance of Earth's Past trilogy. Set against the backdrop of China's Cultural Revolution, it explores humanity's first contact with an alien civilization facing the destruction of their home planet.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
title: The Fellowship of the Ring
description: The first volume of The Lord of the Rings trilogy, following hobbit Frodo Baggins as he begins his quest to destroy the One Ring. A foundational work of modern fantasy literature set in Middle-earth.

author: Harper Lee
title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A coming-of-age story set in 1930s Alabama, following young Scout Finch as her father, lawyer Atticus Finch, defends a Black man falsely accused of rape. A powerful examination of racial injustice and moral courage.

author: Frank Herbert
title: Dune
description: An epic science fiction novel set on the desert planet Arrakis, following Paul Atreides as he navigates political intrigue, ecological warfare, and mystical powers in a complex galactic feudal system.

author: Jane Austen
title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel following Elizabeth Bennet and her complex relationship with the proud Mr. Darcy in Regency-era England. A witty exploration of love, class, and social expectations.

author: Ray Bradbury
title: Fahrenheit 451
description: A dystopian novel set in a future where books are banned and burned by firemen. Guy Montag, a fireman, begins to question his role in society and the value of literature and free thought.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
description: A multigenerational saga of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo. A masterpiece of magical realism that chronicles the rise and fall of a family and their town over a century.

author: Toni Morrison
title: Beloved
description: A haunting novel about Sethe, a former slave haunted by the ghost of her deceased daughter. Set in post-Civil War Ohio, it explores the psychological trauma of slavery and the struggle for freedom and healing.

author: Ursula K. Le Guin
title: The Left Hand of Darkness
description: A groundbreaking science fiction novel about Genly Ai, an envoy to the planet Gethen, whose inhabitants can change gender. A profound exploration of gender, politics, and human nature.

author: Chinua Achebe
title: Things Fall Apart
description: Set in pre-colonial Nigeria, this novel follows Okonkwo, a respected warrior whose life is disrupted by the arrival of European colonizers. A powerful portrayal of the clash between traditional African culture and colonialism.

author: Kurt Vonnegut
title: Slaughterhouse-Five
description: A dark comedy and anti-war novel following Billy Pilgrim, who becomes 'unstuck in time' and experiences his life non-linearly, including his experiences as a prisoner of war during the bombing of Dresden.
